snippet: Uhuru Kenyatta appeared to have secured enough votes to win the race for Kenya’s presidency by a narrow margin, but his opponent’s rejection of the result raised fears of chaos.
abstract: Uhuru Kenyatta, son of Kenya's first president and divisive political figure who has been accused of bankrolling death squads, appears to have secured enough votes to win race for Kenya's presidency; no official announcement is made, and Raila Odinga, other top contender, indicates that he will not concede defeat, raising worries of violence and chaos.
lead_paragraph: Uhuru Kenyatta appeared to have secured enough votes to win the race for Kenya’s presidency by a narrow margin, but his opponent’s rejection of the result raised fears of chaos.

headline.seo: Kenya Race Is Said to Have Winner, but Rival Won’t Concede
headline.main: Kenya Race Is Said to Have Winner, but Rival Won’t Concede
headline.print_headline: Kenyatta Is Reported Winner of Kenyan Presidential Vote
